alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 12:26PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Ocean, northeastern Burlington, Monmouth and eastern Middlesex Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Perth Amboy to near West Freehold to near Wrightstown. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Perth Amboy, Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Lakewood, Middletown, Old Bridge, Jackson, Howell, Sayreville, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Keansburg, Matawan, Manasquan and Highlands. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 12. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 15 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 83 and 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Be alert at the beach since you may need extra time to seek shelter.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Western Monmouth
